intro: Chrysanthemum kinokuniense, commonly known as the Japanese chrysanthemum, is a flowering plant native to Japan. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its daisy-like flowers with yellow to orange centers and white to pink petals. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and prefers well-drained soil and full sun. It is often cultivated for ornamental purposes and is a symbol of longevity and rejuvenation in Japanese culture.
